physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Altered mental status, diffuse weakness, bitemporal wasting, dry oral mucosa, and diffuse ecchymosis of extremities.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient's condition declined over time, with reduced hemoglobin from 10 g/dL to 7.2 g/dL and an increase in white blood cell count from 6400/µL to 11,700/µL.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Cardiomegaly with central vascular congestion and right-sided pleural effusion noted on chest radiograph.
Patient was afebrile, jaundiced, intubated, and receiving norepinephrine and vasopressin. Grimaced in response to painful stimuli.
Repeat blood smear confirmed babesiosis with 10.1% parasitemia.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Post exchange transfusion blood smear showed decrease in parasitemia to <1%.
